items.item_details: The Special Board Meeting will begin at 3:55 p.m. in the Board Room of the Education Center.   .
Information explaining Board meeting procedures and how citizens can address the Board will be read. Written information is located near the entrance to the Board Room.
items.item_text: Information explaining Board meeting procedures and how citizens can address the Board will be read. Written information is located near the entrance to the Board Room.
items.item_text_raw: 2.01 Information explaining Board meeting procedures and how citizens can address the Board will be read. Written information is located near the entrance to the Board Room.

items.item_details: For consideration by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_text: For consideration by the Board of Trustees
items.item_text_raw: 3.01 For consideration by the Board of Trustees

items.item_details:
Members of the public may address the Board on any subject not on tonight’s agenda; however, provisions of the Brown Act (Government Code Section 54954.2(a) and 54954.3) preclude any action.  As an unagendized item, no response is required from the Board or District staff and no action can be taken; however, the Board may instruct the Superintendent to agendize the item for a future meeting.  When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes.
	 
Persons wishing to address the Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Board Room.

meeting_sections.section_name: PUBLIC MEMBERS WHO WISH TO ADDRESS THE BOARD

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item: 5.01  
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Chris Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action of Master Business Relationship Agreement between East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for 2012-13 and 2013-14
		 
		 
The District is party to a joint powers agreement with five other school districts that creates the Metropolitan Education District (MetroED).  The Metropolitan Education District Joint Powers Agreement (JPA) anticipates the negotiation of separate master business agreements between MetroED and each participating school district governing their financial and operational relationships.  Attach is the Master Business Relationship Agreement between East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for the 2012-13 and 2013-14 school years.
		 
		 
FISCAL IMPACT:
FY 2012-13 same level as 2011-12 
FY 2013-14 same level as 2012-13
		 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Master Business Relationship Agreement between East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for the 2012-13 and 2013-14 school years.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Master Business Relationship Agreement between East Side Union High School District and Metropolitan Education District for the 2012-13 and 201-14 school years.
